        Throws:

      • getContextByName

        public static Context getContextByName(net.sf.json.JSONObject parameters,
                                       String parameterName)
                                throws ApiException
        Returns the Context with the given name. The context's name is obtained from the given parameters, whose name is the value of parameterName.

        The parameter must exist, that is, it should be a mandatory parameter, otherwise a runtime exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        parameters - the parameters that contain the context's name
        parameterName - the name of the parameter used to obtain the context's name
        Returns:
        the Context with the given name
        Throws:
        ApiException - If the context with the given name does not exist
        Since:
        2.4.3
        See Also:
        getContextByName(String), JSONObject.getString(String)

      • getContextByName

        public static Context getContextByName(String contextName)
                                throws ApiException
        Returns the Context with the given name.
        Parameters:
        contextName - the name of the context
        Returns:
        the Context with the given name
        Throws:
        ApiException - If the context with the given name does not exist
        Since:
        2.4.3
        See Also:
        getContextByName(JSONObject, String)

      • getAuthority

        public static String getAuthority(String site)
        Returns the authority of the given site (i.e. host ":" port ).

        For example, the result of returning the authority from: 

        http://example.com:8080/some/path?a=b#c
        is: 
        example.com:8080

        If the provided site does not have a port, it's added the default of the used scheme.

        Note: The implementation is optimised to handle only HTTP and HTTPS schemes, the behaviour is undefined for other schemes.

        Parameters:
        site - the site whose authority will be extracted
        Returns:
        the authority of the site
        Since:
        2.5.0
